Class ErrorCondition<I>

java.lang.Object
functions.ErrorCondition<I>
Type Parameters:
I - the type of input that this condition validates
public class ErrorCondition<I> extends Object
A condition that, when met, causes a generated function to throw a specified exception.

ErrorCondition instances are immutable and thread-safe. They consist of:

  • A class of exception to throw
  • A predicate defining the error condition
  • An error message to use in the exception
When the predicate evaluates to true for a given input, it indicates that the input is invalid and should trigger the specified exception with the provided error message.

Usage Example

// Create an error condition for negative numbers ErrorCondition<Integer> negativeNumber = new ErrorCondition<>( IllegalArgumentException.class, num -> num < 0, "Input cannot be negative" ); // Example with custom exception ErrorCondition<Integer> tooLarge = new ErrorCondition<>( RangeException.class, num -> num > 1000, "Number cannot be larger than 1000" );

  • Constructor Details

    • ErrorCondition

      public ErrorCondition(Class<? extends Exception> exceptionClass, Predicate<I> condition, String errorMessage)
      Creates a new error condition with the specified exception class, predicate, and error message.
      Parameters:
      exceptionClass - the class of exception to throw when the condition is met
      condition - the predicate that defines when an error should occur
      errorMessage - the message to include in the exception when the condition is met
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is null or if the exception class doesn't have a constructor that takes a string message

    • ErrorCondition

      public ErrorCondition(Class<? extends Exception> exceptionClass, String conditionDescription, String errorMessage)
      Creates a new error condition with the specified exception class, predicate, and error message.
      Parameters:
      exceptionClass - the class of exception to throw when the condition is met
      conditionDescription - the description of the condition
      errorMessage - the message to include in the exception when the condition is met
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is null or if the exception class doesn't have a constructor that takes a string message

      Throws:
